sentences.english: Eggs can be incubated by the female or artificially in an incubator.
sentences.chinese: 蛋可以由雌蟒或者人工用孵蛋器孵化。

sentences.english: Incubation lasts for 42 to 45 days before the chicks hatch.
sentences.chinese: 一般而言，孵蛋的工作爲期約42到45天。

sentences.english: The female bird incubates the eggs for about sixteen days while the male brings food.
sentences.chinese: 雌鳥孵蛋差不多十六天，在這期間，雄鳥帶回食物。

sentences.english: The hens don't sit this year.
sentences.chinese: 這些母雞今年都不孵蛋。

sentences.english: When do the sparrows' eggs hatch?
It is time for hens to brood.
sentences.chinese: 該是母雞孵蛋的時候了。

sentences.english: He mentioned this to the goose, who was sitting quietly in a corner of the sheepfold.
sentences.chinese: 它對那隻正在羊圈的一角靜靜孵蛋的母鵝說話。

sentences.english: Replace the eggs to stones when the incubating hen is distracted.
sentences.chinese: 趁正在孵蛋的母雞不注意，把蛋換成石頭。

sentences.english: Many return to the exact beach where they hatched to lay their own eggs.
sentences.chinese: 許多海龜回到海灘孵蛋。

sentences.english: During these periods the birds will lie on the cage floor as if trying to lay or hatch eggs.
sentences.chinese: 這些時期，鳥兒會趴在籠底，好像在下蛋或孵蛋。

sentences.english: 'As if it wasn't trouble enough hatching the eggs, ' said the Pigeon;
sentences.chinese: “僅僅是孵蛋就夠麻煩的啦，”鴿子說。“

sentences.english: The hen was sitting on her eggs .

definition: to give birth (animals)/to bear a litter
(of animals) to give birth/to foal, to whelp etc
